https://us.orderspoon.com/mister-spots 11/11

Address: 808 S State St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Casual joint serving Philadelphia-style hoagies, steak sandwiches & signature wings.

summary.snippet: "Cool staff, nice location, great food and good customer service!"
"I wouldn’t eat here I ordered the 🥗 salad & wings; with the CHEESE STEAK."
"The PHILLY'S, the Hoagies, the sauce to the soda...HANDS DOWN THE BEST."

most_relevant.description:
Their Philly cheesesteaks are too good-

The meat was juicy, cooked onions were flavourful, and the cheese in between all of it just made for an amazing sandwich. Their 10” sandwiches are more like a foot long too.

The restaurant has a very old school vibe to it, looks like it’s straight out of the late 80’s. Cozy and comfortable. The folks working there are super friendly too. Can’t ask for anything more.

For a local place it was all right. We were just up the road at Yost Center for my son's hockey and wanted to grab a quick bite. I got the steak sub and a bag of Lay's potato chips. I'd say it was a little better than going to Subway. Love the fact that they have Pepsi
First time to AA and wanted to try the hot local spots and this was on the list.  This is a hole in the wall with decent food.  Can say I did it but not high on the list for next time.

Was recommended and sent here by some friends from U of M football team.
First time, will not be our last! Was told to ask for the owner Keith and was greeted with a huge smile and a come on in.
Food was absolutely outta this world amazing, hands down top five place in AA!!
Even had a special request from my son for a grilled cheese, not even on the menu and it wasn’t even a question!
Absolutely amazing place and even more outstanding people!! Go Blue〽️

Zach, who took my order over the phone. He was really nice. His tone, on the phone, didn't make me feel like a inconvenience. The order was a little pricey, the food was good. Living about 2 miles away. Everything was still hot. And the delivery driver was nice.
Did the pull up for lunch at Mr. Spots for cheesesteak. Haven't been here  since grad school and it still taste delicious. Definitely a college student landmark.
Awesome owner, very welcoming to those visiting for the first time. Phenomenal food!
